subtasks: Soak seeds in water for 24 hours prior to planting
Plant seeds in moist paper towel or peat pellet
Place seeds in a warm location or plastic bag for 2 weeks
Transplant seedlings to pots if growing indoors
Place indoor plants on a warm sunny windowsill or under grow lights
Acclimatize outdoor seedlings to outdoor conditions over 7-10 days
Plant outdoor seedlings in prepared beds with fertile, moist, well-drained soil
Prune chili plants by removing growing tips of flowering shoots to promote branching
Fertilize pruned plants with organic high nitrogen fertilizer
Harvest chili peppers when they are large enough, whether green or fully colored
